description: Tinea Corporis, also known as ringworm, is a common fungal infection of the skin that can cause red, itchy, and scaly patches.
possible causes: Fungal infection from dermatophytes like Trichophyton or Microsporum species
Direct contact with an infected person or animal
Sharing contaminated items like towels or clothing
symptoms: Red, circular rash with raised edges
treatments: Oral antifungal medications in severe cases
Keeping the affected area clean and dry
